title: Road to be closed while crews repair sinkhole 21 hours ago
content: GRAND TRAVERSE COUNTY, Mich. (WPBN/WGTU) -- The Grand Traverse County Road Commission will be doing an emergency repair of a sinkhole and the culvert near it on County Road 633.    Starting at 6:00 a.m. on Monday June 4th, County Road 633 will be closed from Miller Road to the intersection of Hamlin and Youker Road.    Residents who live in that area will be able to get back to their homes.    The road is expected to be open again on Tuesday June 5th at 5:00 p.m.    During the closure drivers will be detoured to M-37 but drivers are encouraged to find alternate routes to their destinations.    The Grand Traverse County Road Commission was made aware of the sinkhole on Monday and has temporarily patched it up.    However, the commission says it's important to do a permanent repair to keep the area safe and prevent accidents and damage to vehicles.
